content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
• No new structures have been successfully placed. The agent made repeated attempts to supply a Lab at position (0.5, 2.5) but was unable to place one due to missing Lab items and cascading crafting failures. Although smelting operations were performed using furnaces located at (5.0, 5.0) for iron and (–27.0, –60.0) for copper, these entities were pre‐existing and not newly created by the agent’s actions.

ERROR TIPS
• API Usage
 – When retrieving entities, ensure that you use the correct parameter types. Do not pass unsupported keyword arguments (for example, avoid using “radius” if it is not defined) and do not supply extra positional arguments if the function accepts none.

• Inventory and Placement Checks
 – Check that the required items (such as a Lab) are present in the inventory before attempting to place them.
 – Verify available resources and prerequisites prior to launching placement operations.

• Handling Function Returns
 – Confirm that functions returning collections (like get_entities) do not return None before iterating over the results.

• Crafting Dependencies
 – Ensure all sub-components needed for crafting (for example, iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, copper cables) are available or producible. Establish the necessary production chain (including proper smelting setups) before attempting to craft advanced items like a Lab.
